summary: This document is a Know Your Customer (KYC) report detailing the financial relationships and account information related to Jeffrey Epstein and associated individuals. It includes information about account managers, account purposes, and the financial profiles of Epstein and his associates, including Darren Indyke and Harry Beller. The document highlights the establishment of accounts for Mort, Inc. and the financial activities surrounding these accounts. This document appears to be a record related to the compliance and approval processes at Deutsche Bank, specifically regarding client relationships and due diligence. It includes signatures from various professionals within the bank, indicating their acknowledgment of the policies and procedures in place for client management and anti-money laundering efforts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a client of Deutsche Bank and is involved in the establishment of new accounts. His financial background and wealth sources are detailed in the document.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is identified as a Client Facing Professional who signed the document, indicating his involvement in the client approval process.

persons.context: Harry Beller is identified as an accountant and is related to the accounts established for Mort, Inc.

connections.description: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously established a connection while at JP Morgan.
Darren Indyke is employed by Southern Financial LLC, which is associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
Harry Beller is involved in the financial management of accounts related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Both are employees of Deutsche Bank, with Paul Morris working under the oversight of Brian M. Biggar.
Gwen Hill signed on behalf of Janice Franklin, indicating a working relationship in compliance.
Both are Client Facing Professionals at Deutsche Bank, indicating they work in similar roles.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a client of Deutsche Bank and has established multiple accounts, including Mort, Inc.
Darren Indyke is listed as an authorized signer for Epstein's accounts.
Paul Morris has a history of managing Epstein's accounts from his previous position at JP Morgan.
Harry Beller is identified as an accountant related to the financial activities of Epstein.
The document includes details about the financial profiles and expected transactions for Epstein's accounts.
The document includes signatures from multiple Deutsche Bank professionals, indicating their acknowledgment of compliance policies.
The document emphasizes the importance of due diligence in client relationships and anti-money laundering efforts.
Gwen Hill signed on behalf of Janice Franklin, indicating a collaborative compliance effort.
The document is marked as confidential and is subject to federal rules regarding criminal procedure.
